content:
I’m a Seattle-based data analyst, cartographer, and designer with experience in campaigns, local government, and nonprofit research. I enjoy helping resourceful teams make the most of data and exploring the connections between locations, decisions, and outcomes. I specialize in spatial data, Python, PostgreSQL, and open source tools.
Contact email or twitter

title: Observations on Voter Turnout for Municipal Elections in King County Cities

content: Paper walk map produced for political campaigns nbefore the age of digital canvassing tools. Shaded and numbered parcels indicate the locations of targeted voters.
title: Canvass Maps

summary: Integrated several datasets to develop voter turnout models with machine learning algorithms
title: Housing-Based Voter Turnout Modeling

summary: An interactive atlas of electoral results for every election held in King County since 2004
title: King County Atlas of Politics

title: San Francisco Bay North

title: San Francisco Bay South

content: Built in QGIS with data from NOAA, US Department of Agricutlure, San Juan County, Whatcom County, and Skagit County
summary: Cartography blending nautical chart data with LiDAR data and aerial photography
title: San Juan Islands Map

summary: Seattle to Stevenson between St. Helens and Adams
title: Seattle to Stevenson

summary: Following the Tolt Pipeline and Snoqualmie River
title: Tolt Pipeline - Snoqualmie River

content: Was responsible for the contents of the backend databases used to provide address-customized ballots to millions of users of VotersEdge.org, a popular online voter guide application.
summary: Was responsible for the contents of the backend databases used to provide address-customized ballots to millions of users of VotersEdge.org, a popular online voter guide application.
title: Voter's Edge
